Introduction to tumopp

Source: vignettes/tumopp.Rmd
tumopp.Rmd

Basic usage

This is an R interface of tumopp, a tumor growth simulator in C++. The parameter values and resulting populations are returned in a nested tibble.

library(tumopp)
result = tumopp("-D3 -Cmoore -k10 -N1000")
colnames(result)
#>  [1] "alpha0"     "benchmark"  "beta0"      "coord"      "delta0"    
#>  [6] "dimensions" "extinction" "interval"   "local"      "ma"        
#> [11] "max"        "max_time"   "mb"         "md"         "mm"        
#> [16] "mutate"     "origin"     "outdir"     "path"       "plateau"   
#> [21] "prolif"     "record"     "resistant"  "rho0"       "sa"        
#> [26] "sb"         "sd"         "seed"       "shape"      "sm"        
#> [31] "symmetric"  "treatment"  "ua"         "ub"         "ud"        
#> [36] "um"         "verbose"    "population" "graph"
colnames(result$population[[1L]])
#> [1] "x"        "y"        "z"        "id"       "ancestor" "birth"   
#> [7] "death"    "omega"

Explore parameter space

See tumopp -h or C++ library documentation generated by doxygen for available parameters.

.const = c(D = 3, C = "hex", N = 1000)
.alt = list(
  k = c("1", "1e6"),
  L = c("const", "linear", "step"),
  P = c("random", "mindrag")
)

# Generate combinations of arguments
argslist = make_args(alt = .alt, const = .const, each = 2L)
results = tumopp(argslist)
